title: Pressing Caps Lock causes lowercase t keypress
author: swfreak18
body_snippet:
<!--
Only file GitHub issues for bugs and feature requests.  All other topics will be closed.

Before opening an issue, please search for a duplicate or closed issue.
Please provide as much detail as possible for us to fix your issue.
-->

<!-- Bug -->
Pressing the Caps Lock key causes a lowercase t keypress when connected to a Mac via VNC.

|Operating system | Windows 10 x64 |
|mRemoteNG version| 1.74  |

comments.snippet: Thanks for the report. We will need to see if this is a bug on the mRemoteNG side or the VncSharp side.
comments.author: sparerd

comments.snippet:
I'm unable to reproduce this issue:
Everything working fine on **Windows 10 1803 build 17134.167** with **mRemoteNG 1.76.4.16229** connected to **OS X 10.9.5 (13F1911)**.
comments.author: farosch

comments.snippet:
Closing this one as of inactivity.
@swfreak18 Since you never replied, the issue being fairly old and no other user seems to be having this issue, I will close this now. Feel free to create a new issue if this problem still exists for you.
comments.author: farosch

comments.snippet: Still having the issue with Windows 10 1803 and mRemoteNG 1.76.20.24615 connected to a Mac running OS 10.13.6.
comments.author: swfreak18

comments.snippet: To clarify, this is when the built-in VNC server is enabled on the Mac in System Preferences. I have not tried using other VNC servers.
comments.author: swfreak18

comments.snippet: I've been able to reproduce it with the latest mRemoteNG Alpha 1.77.0.41252 and OS X 10.13.6.
comments.author: farosch
